answers.text: We help make your life easier by unlocking the potential of technology
answers.response: You got it! Our commitment is anchored in our customers’ desire for ease. When we stay true to it we give them exactly what they need. Bravo!

answers.text:
We get your life back on track
through tech
answers.response: We do more than just fix tech. We help customers get more from it so their lives are a little easier and a lot more amazing.

answers.text: We show you what’s possible today and tomorrow with technology
answers.response: Nice try. Although “discovery” is an element of our commitment, it isn’t the only one. You’re missing a key benefit that customers deeply value.

answers.text: We fix it so your life is perfect
answers.response: While we can’t promise perfection, we hold the key to something better…

question: Why do our Experience Principles matter?

answers.text: They guide specs and requirements for product & service innovation
answers.response: Not quite! They could apply to this, but they inform so much more.

answers.text: They come together to guide everything we create – from experiences to processes to communications.
answers.response: That’s right! They’re the building blocks that focus our Story, making it consistent across the organization and relevant to our customers. They describe us when we’re at our best.

answers.text:
They are the creative brief for external
ad campaigns
answers.response: Not quite! They are internal guardrails for our organization, that enable everything that faces customers to be clear, compelling and consistent.

answers.text: They give us a platter of features to choose from when designing a service
answers.response: Try again! Unless all of our principles are guiding our design, we would have disjointed experiences and our Experience Principles enable consistency.

question: See if you can go three for three. Which one of these nail all three of our Experience Principles:

answers.text: Remarkably Human, Delightfully Simple and Actually Helpful
answers.response: Exactly! These principles define what’s different about the Asurion experience. They guide how our brand comes to life and are relevant to both our partners and consumers.

answers.text: Unexpectedly Kind, Extremely Easy, and Intelligently Powered
answers.response: Let’s try again. Our experience isn’t unexpected. Plus, you’re missing the element of “discovery.” And while Intelligence does power our service, this is about our customers.

answers.text: Truly Personable, Totally Effortless, and Always Accommodating
answers.response: Not quite. Our experience goes beyond being personable, “Totally Effortless” discounts our hard work and “Always Accommodating” is a bit too deferential.

answers.text: Amazingly Friendly, Deeply Honest, and Noticeably Smart
answers.response: Try again! While we are a friendly bunch, “Amazingly Friendly” is overkill. “Deeply Honest” is a tad cynical and not authentic to us. “Noticeably Smart”…a bit braggadocious, don’t you think?

question:
You’ve got this! Fill in our Experience Principle… 
Remarkably Human: “We are powered by people who _______”

answers.text: Take pride in taking care of you
answers.response: Aced it! This is core to what drives us as employees and makes Asurion different.

answers.text: Know everything about technology
answers.response: While we know our stuff, being Remarkably Human is about showing our heart and being humble as we help our customers.

answers.text: Love helping people more than technology itself
answers.response: Close, but not quite! The first half is true, but not at the expense of technology.

answers.text: Are actually highly emotive robots
answers.response: You’re a clever one. But, try again!

question: Which one is NOT Remarkably Human?

answers.text: Being optimistic
answers.response: Not quite. Our people are optimistic about technology and what it can do for our customers.

answers.text: Treating people like people
answers.response: Try again! Our people get it. They’re empathetic, giving customers the relevant help they need.

answers.text: Creating real moments of connection
answers.response: Correction. Connections are core to our experience, turning interactions into relationships.

answers.text:
Downplaying tech expertise to be
more relatable
answers.response: Remarkable! You got it. Being human doesn’t have to mean being so humble that customers question our expertise.

question:
Now it’s your turn. Fill in our Experience Principle… 
Delightfully Simple: “We make it easy for you to _______”

answers.text:
Discover how incredible
technology can be
answers.response: You’re incredible! We remove complexity so customers can get more from the tech they love and rely on.

answers.text: Solve all of life’s problems
answers.response: That’s a bit of a reach. We focus on the possibilities of people’s technology.

answers.text: Learn the ins and outs of your tech
answers.response: Close, but this one’s about making the “a-ha” moments possible.

answers.text: Be a tech genius
answers.response: Sorry, but this one’s about customers learning what they want, not becoming the next Einstein.

question: Which one is NOT Delightfully Simple?

answers.text: Removing complexity
answers.response: Try again! Simplicity isn’t complex. We make it easier for customers to get what they want.

answers.text: Just “making it work”
answers.response: Try again! Asurion can indeed take care of it for you, quickly and easily.

answers.text: Enabling discovery
answers.response: Not quite. Delight goes beyond ease, to the discovery of what lies behind the complexity.

answers.text: Ending a call as fast as possible
answers.response: Delightful! Simplicity doesn’t mean speed. Understanding comes first, and if that requires more time then we make sure to give it. It’s what sets us apart.

question:
Complete me. Fill in our Experience Principle… 
Actually Helpful: “We understand what it takes to make your tech work better _________”

answers.text: Because we’re on top of tech
answers.response: That's actually right! We want to convey our expertise and show that we know what’s next for tech and the tech help needs that will come with it. Good job!

answers.text: When you can’t
answers.response: That may be true, but this one speaks to our expertise too.

answers.text: Than ever
answers.response: Not quite. This one speaks to the “why” behind our understanding.

answers.text: Because we know it all
answers.response: Try again! This one means staying in the know without being a know-it-all.

question: Which one is NOT Actually Helpful?

answers.text: Being personal
answers.response: Try again! We know, understand and remember our customers, delivering a unique experience.

answers.text: Creating a seamless experience
answers.response: This one’s right. We want to be the “one-stop-shop” for any tech help need.

answers.text: Drawing on past experiences to help
answers.response: This powers our expertise. It’s part of being Actually Helpful. Try again!

answers.text: Overusing technical terms and acronyms
answers.response: Acronyms are far from Actually Helpful. We don’t have to talk in a technical way to show that we’re on top of tech. You got it!

question: Which of these statements about Asurion experts is true?

answers.text: All of our experts set aside dedicated time to keep their tech skills strong
answers.response: We keep our training on point. But that’s not all…

answers.text: 85% of the US population is within 30 miles of an Asurion expert
answers.response: That’s right, but also…

answers.text: Our Asurion experts took 35 million US calls in 2018
answers.response: Yes and…

answers.text: All of the above
answers.response: That’s right! All of the above are true. Goes to show just how excellent our experts are at delivering on our commitment to customers.
